medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient reports onset of right lower quadrant abdominal pain that began abruptly at 4 AM yesterday, waking her from sleep. The pain has persisted and is described as occasionally stabbing. Associated symptoms include nausea and subjective fevers/chills. The patient denies vomiting but reports constipation today, though had been experiencing looser stools than usual since a prior unspecified date. An episode of similar pain occurred one week ago and self-resolved after 20 minutes.
medical_history.family_history: Brother with short gut syndrome secondary to NEC as an infant. Mother has diabetes mellitus. Father has gout. No family history of colon cancer or inflammatory bowel disease.
